title: Strong Applicant with Excellent Credit Profile - Approved
description: Approved case from November 2025 with strong applicant profile
content:
Historical Case: Strong Applicant with Excellent Credit Profile

Case ID: case-001
Date: November 15, 2025
Decision: APPROVED
Risk Level: LOW
Risk Score: 87

APPLICANT PROFILE:
- Annual Income: $185,000
- Employment Status: Full-time
- Years at Employer: 4 years
- Industry: Technology

LOAN DETAILS:
- Loan Amount: $450,000
- Property Value: $575,000
- Loan Purpose: Home Purchase
- Loan Term: 30 years

RISK METRICS:
- Credit Score: 745 (Good)
- DTI Ratio: 22.5% (Low Risk)
- LTV Ratio: 78.3% (Low Risk)
- Cash Reserves: 8.2 months (Strong)

DECISION RATIONALE:
Applicant demonstrates strong credit profile with excellent income stability, healthy reserves, and favorable LTV ratio. Credit score in good range. All standard underwriting criteria met. No compensating factors needed. Recommend competitive rate.

title: Good Applicant with Elevated DTI - Approved with Conditions
description: Approved with conditions case requiring PMI and additional documentation
content:
Historical Case: Good Applicant with Elevated DTI

Case ID: case-002
Date: October 22, 2025
Decision: APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS
Risk Level: MEDIUM
Risk Score: 68

APPLICANT PROFILE:
- Annual Income: $120,000
- Employment Status: Full-time
- Years at Employer: 3 years
- Industry: Healthcare

LOAN DETAILS:
- Loan Amount: $380,000
- Property Value: $425,000
- Loan Purpose: Home Purchase

RISK METRICS:
- Credit Score: 712 (Good)
- DTI Ratio: 41.2% (Elevated)
- LTV Ratio: 89.4% (Elevated)
- Cash Reserves: 4.5 months (Adequate)

DECISION RATIONALE:
Applicant has good credit score and stable employment. DTI at 41.2% is elevated but within QM guidelines. High LTV requires PMI. Compensating factors: stable healthcare industry employment, no derogatory credit history.

CONDITIONS:
1. PMI required
2. Verify 2 additional months bank statements
3. Employment verification within 10 days of closing

Rate adjustment of +0.25% recommended.

title: Self-Employed Applicant with Strong Assets - Escalated then Approved
description: Self-employed case escalated to credit committee and approved
content:
Historical Case: Self-Employed Applicant with Strong Assets

Case ID: case-003
Date: September 8, 2025
Decision: APPROVED (after escalation)
Risk Level: MEDIUM
Risk Score: 72

APPLICANT PROFILE:
- Annual Income: $225,000
- Employment Status: Self-employed
- Years Self-Employed: 6 years
- Industry: Consulting

LOAN DETAILS:
- Loan Amount: $520,000
- Property Value: $680,000
- Loan Purpose: Home Purchase

RISK METRICS:
- Credit Score: 768 (Excellent)
- DTI Ratio: 38.5% (Elevated)
- LTV Ratio: 76.5% (Low Risk)
- Cash Reserves: 14.2 months (Substantial)

DECISION RATIONALE:
Self-employed status requires additional scrutiny. However, applicant has excellent credit score 768, substantial reserves of 14+ months, and favorable LTV. Six years of consistent self-employment income documented.

CONDITIONS:
1. Two years complete tax returns
2. CPA letter confirming business viability
3. Year-to-date profit/loss statement

Escalated to senior underwriter due to self-employment. Approved based on strong compensating factors.

title: Applicant with Poor Credit and Insufficient Reserves - Denied
description: Denied case due to multiple critical risk factors
content:
Historical Case: Applicant with Poor Credit and Insufficient Reserves

Case ID: case-004
Date: August 30, 2025
Decision: DENIED
Risk Level: CRITICAL
Risk Score: 32

APPLICANT PROFILE:
- Annual Income: $85,000
- Employment Status: Full-time
- Years at Employer: 1 year
- Industry: Retail

LOAN DETAILS:
- Loan Amount: $300,000
- Property Value: $310,000
- Loan Purpose: Home Purchase

RISK METRICS:
- Credit Score: 562 (Poor - below 580 minimum)
- DTI Ratio: 48.5% (High - exceeds 43% max)
- LTV Ratio: 96.8% (Very High - exceeds 95%)
- Cash Reserves: 1.2 months (Insufficient)

DECISION RATIONALE:
Multiple critical risk factors:
1. Credit score 562 below 580 minimum
2. DTI 48.5% exceeds 43% QM maximum
3. LTV 96.8% exceeds conventional 95% max
4. Only 1.2 months reserves, below 2-month minimum

No compensating factors available. Application denied.

RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Improve credit score to at least 620
- Reduce debt to lower DTI below 43%
- Build savings to 3+ months reserves
- Consider FHA program in future

title: First-Time Homebuyer with Gift Funds - Approved
description: First-time buyer approved with gift funds for down payment
content:
Historical Case: First-Time Homebuyer with Gift Funds

Case ID: case-005
Date: December 1, 2025
Decision: APPROVED
Risk Level: LOW-MEDIUM
Risk Score: 75

APPLICANT PROFILE:
- Annual Income: $95,000
- Employment Status: Full-time
- Years at Employer: 2 years
- Industry: Finance
- First-Time Buyer: Yes

LOAN DETAILS:
- Loan Amount: $285,000
- Property Value: $320,000
- Loan Purpose: Home Purchase

RISK METRICS:
- Credit Score: 738 (Good)
- DTI Ratio: 32.4% (Low Risk)
- LTV Ratio: 89.1% (Elevated)
- Cash Reserves: 3.8 months (Adequate)

DECISION RATIONALE:
First-time homebuyer with strong credit profile. LTV elevated at 89.1% but within PMI guidelines. Gift funds of $25,000 from parents properly documented per Fannie Mae requirements.

CONDITIONS:
1. Gift letter from parents for $25,000
2. PMI required until 80% LTV
3. First-time homebuyer certification

Strong candidate for first-time buyer program.

title: Recent Bankruptcy Disqualifies Applicant - Denied
description: Denied due to bankruptcy within waiting period
content:
Historical Case: Recent Bankruptcy Disqualifies Applicant

Case ID: case-006
Date: July 18, 2025
Decision: DENIED
Risk Level: MEDIUM (disqualified by bankruptcy)
Risk Score: 58

APPLICANT PROFILE:
- Annual Income: $110,000
- Employment Status: Full-time
- Years at Employer: 5 years
- Industry: Manufacturing
- Bankruptcy: Chapter 7 discharged 2 years ago

LOAN DETAILS:
- Loan Amount: $250,000
- Property Value: $350,000
- Loan Purpose: Home Purchase

RISK METRICS:
- Credit Score: 642 (Fair - rebuilding)
- DTI Ratio: 28.5% (Low Risk)
- LTV Ratio: 71.4% (Low Risk)
- Cash Reserves: 6.5 months (Strong)

DECISION RATIONALE:
Despite favorable LTV and strong reserves, applicant has Chapter 7 bankruptcy discharged only 2 years ago. Fannie Mae requires 4-year waiting period for conventional loans.

RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Reapply after 4-year waiting period (July 2027)
2. Consider FHA program with 2-year waiting period (eligible now)
3. Continue building credit and payment history
